definition: difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
erhua variant of 差一點|差一点[cha4 yi1 dian3]

sentences.english: The monster had all but wrecked the ship.
sentences.chinese: 那妖物差一点毁了这条船。

sentences.english: On the quiz, my son was a bit weak on history.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子的历史成绩在测试中稍差一点儿。

sentences.english: Jack cycled too fast and almost ran down a school boy near the park.
sentences.chinese: 杰克车骑得太快了，在公园附近差一点撞倒一小学生。

sentences.english: I told him that he had nearly caused a bad accident.
sentences.chinese: 我对他说他差一点造成一起恶性事故。

sentences.english: I just avoided running over the cat.
He escapes into the elevator just before Lincoln can catch him.
sentences.chinese: 狙击手逃进了电梯里，林肯差一点就抓住了他。

sentences.english: We thought we had captured the spy, but he is slippery as an eel.
sentences.chinese: 那个间谍实在太狡猾，我们差一点就逮到他。

sentences.english: As the steamer came near to the landing-place, it began to slacken speed.
sentences.chinese: 因为汽船差一点就要登陆地方，它开始减少速度。

sentences.english: When an accident nearly happens, we say it is a close shave .
sentences.chinese: 当车祸差一点发生的时候，我们说那是九死一生。

sentences.english: Of course, then you were nearly crushed to death in front of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 那天，就在我的眼皮底下你差一点儿被车轧死。

sentences.english: I liked the deluxe edition, but I could afford only a second best.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢精装版，但我只买得起一本稍差一点的。

sentences.english: The boy was nearly run over by a car.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩差一点儿被汽车轧了。
我也差一点有可能失去你。

sentences.english: I came near being drowned in the attempt to swim across.
sentences.chinese: 我在试图游到对岸去时差一点被淹死。

sentences.english: The right wrist of the sheriff was all but dislocated.
sentences.chinese: 郡长的右腕差一点脱了臼。

sentences.english: The accident just about finished him as a footballer.
sentences.chinese: 这次事故差一点结束了他的足球生涯。

definition: erhua variant of 差一點|差一点[cha4 yi1 dian3]
if it were not for/but for
in a short while/all at once/all of a sudden
lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
